intro: Hydrocotyle forrestii, commonly known as the Forest's spurge laurel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, arrow-shaped leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender stalks. Hydrocotyle forrestii thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
